comments.content: Custom lettering. You might enjoy [Gentry](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117112735/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=DF.121647.0.0), [Digital Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117112735/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=EF.104015.0.0), or [Pasadena](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117112735/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=pasadena).

Oddly enough, I think a good ’gravis’ replacement could be [’Gravel’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117112735/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/gravel/), by Rian Hughes (Device). It has a lot of similarities, and could be tweaked to be even closer.

- Mike Yanega

I’ve always thought [Benguiat Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080117112735/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=18&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=benguiat+gothic&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=gravis) somewhat resembled the gravis logo - it might be a good starting point as well.

- Lex

I have no idea what these gravis people do, but we just designed everything for Germany’s biggest Apple dealer, also called Gravis. I attach a few images. Gravis Rounded was designed by Christian Schwartz, based on FF Unit Alternate, and Gravis Hybrid by Susanna Dulkinys, based on a bitmap font i designed, based on FF Unit.
